question: What’s the first section you browse in the bookstore or library?
ans: The young adult section. I like to keep my reading PG-13.
The new adult section. The steamier the book, the better.
The fiction section. The main priority is forgetting reality.
The monthly displays. I like to see what other readers recommend.

question: You have the day to yourself. What’s your prime reading location?
ans: On the couch with a blanket and my favorite music on in the background.
A coffee shop, preferably a seat next to a window.
My bed. There’s nothing like cuddling up with a good book.
On a hammock outdoors. Reading in the sun is truly magical.

question: In your eyes, how should a book make you feel?
ans: Exhilarated, like I’ve entered into a new and fantastical world.
All warm and cozy, like a giant hug.
On edge, like I’m being watched.
Calm and peaceful, like I’m at a spa.

question: What’s your go-to reading beverage?
ans: Coffee. There’s no tastier way to stay alert.
Tea. It warms my soul, like a book.
Water. Staying hydrated is as important as reading.
Nothing. I don’t sip on drinks while I read.

question: Do you prefer standalones or book series?
ans: Book series. I always know what to read next!
Standalones. No commitment. No cliffhangers. Perfect.
Either. I’ll pick up anything if I like the genre or author.
Series are fine, but I won’t read anything that has more than 3 books.

question: Out of all these book tropes, which is your favorite?
ans: One Bed. Oh, the shenanigans that unfold with 2 people and 1 bed.
Enemies to Lovers. Nothing beats the hero falling for the villain.
Second Chance. Every character is morally grey.
The Chosen One. Give me all the prophecies and save-the-world pressures.

question: The weekend’s here and you can’t wait to relax. What TV show do you binge?
ans: Friends or Schitt's Creek
American Horror Story or The Walking Dead
Lost or Stranger Things
WandaVision or Once Upon a Time

question: What’s something a book must have?
ans: A fast pace. I want to be hooked from the very start.
A love triangle. Give me ships or give me death!
A mystery. I like playing detective.
A plot twist. Things are more interesting when they are unexpected.

question: What do you like to see in a main character?
ans: A sense of humor. They should make me laugh.
Relatable flaws. I want to see myself in them.
A strong will. Stubbornness keeps things interesting.
Kindness. I want to like and support them.

question: If a book has this, it’s an immediate turn off:
ans: History. I prefer my stories in the present time.
Romance. It’s fine as a subplot but not as the main event.
Cliches. I want to read something original.
Magic. Let’s keep things realistic.

question: What’s something your life needs a little bit more of these days?
ans: Excitement.
Drama.
Romance.
Adventure.

question: When it comes to book covers, what are you drawn to?
ans: Cartoon graphic designs. They're so bright and crisp.
Fun lettering and silhouette images. I make up my own interpretations.
Artistic illustrations. The more plot Easter eggs, the better!
Realistic photos. I like to imagine myself on the cover.
